intro: Lotononis flava, commonly known as the yellow lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
